description: EU directive regulating payment services and payment service providers, introducing Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) and open banking requirements.

key_requirements.title: Strong Customer Authentication (SCA)
key_requirements.description: Payment service providers must implement multi-factor authentication for electronic payments
requirements: Two or more authentication elements from knowledge, possession, and inherence
Independence of elements ensuring breach of one does not compromise others
Dynamic linking for remote electronic transactions
Apply SCA for payment initiation, account access, and remote transactions

key_requirements.title: Open Banking API Access
key_requirements.description: Account servicing payment service providers must provide access to payment account through dedicated APIs
requirements: Provide APIs for account information access
Enable payment initiation through APIs
Ensure same level of availability as online banking
Support standardized API protocols (Berlin Group, Open Banking UK, STET)

key_requirements.title: Third Party Provider (TPP) Registration
key_requirements.description: Payment initiation and account information service providers must be authorized and registered
requirements: Obtain authorization from competent national authority
Maintain professional indemnity insurance or comparable guarantee
Register in national registry of payment institutions
Comply with capital requirements based on transaction volume

key_requirements.title: Customer Data Protection
key_requirements.description: Payment service providers must ensure secure processing and transmission of sensitive payment data
requirements: Encrypt sensitive payment data in transit and at rest
Implement access controls and audit trails
Ensure GDPR compliance for personal data processing
Maintain incident response and breach notification procedures

key_requirements.title: Transaction Monitoring and Reporting
key_requirements.description: Detect and report suspicious transactions and security incidents
requirements: Implement real-time fraud detection systems
Report major security incidents to national competent authority
Notify customers of suspected or actual fraud
Maintain transaction logs for minimum 5 years

key_requirements.title: Payment Service User Rights
key_requirements.description: Ensure transparency and protect payment service user rights
requirements: Provide clear information on fees and charges
Enable liability protection for unauthorized transactions
Implement refund rights for unauthorized or incorrectly executed transactions
Provide timely notification of transaction execution

compliance_checklist: Strong Customer Authentication implemented for all electronic payments
APIs available for Third Party Providers with same availability as online banking
TPP authorization obtained from national competent authority
Customer data encrypted in transit and at rest
GDPR compliance ensured for payment data processing
Fraud detection and transaction monitoring systems operational
Payment service user information and consent mechanisms implemented
Regulatory Technical Standards (RTS) on SCA compliance verified

penalties.description: Non-compliance penalties vary by member state, typically including:
examples: Administrative fines up to 5% of annual turnover
Civil liability for damages to payment service users

regulatory_bodies.name: National Competent Authorities
regulatory_bodies.role: Authorization and supervision in each member state
